verses.text: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth \add it\add* to heart: And merciful men \add are\add* taken away, none considering That the righteous is taken away from the evil \add to come\add*.
He shall enter \add into\add* peace: They shall rest in their beds, \add Each one\add* walking \add in\add* his uprightness.
But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, The seed of the adulterer and the whore.
Against whom do ye sport yourselves? Against whom make ye a wide mouth, \add and\add* draw out the tongue? \add Are\add* ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
Inflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, Slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?

Among the smooth \add stones\add* of the stream \add is\add* thy portion; They, they \add are\add* thy lot: Even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, Thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: Even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.

Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: For thou hast discovered \add thyself to another\add* than me, and art gone up; Thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee \add a covenant\add* with them; Thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest \add it\add*.
And thou wentest to the king with ointment, And didst increase thy perfumes, And didst send thy messengers far off, And didst debase \add thyself even\add* unto hell.
Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; \add Yet\add* saidst thou not, There is no hope: Thou hast found the life of thine hand; Therefore thou wast not grieved.
And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, And hast not remembered me, nor laid \add it\add* to thy heart? Have not I held my peace even of old, And thou fearest me not?
I will declare thy righteousness, And thy works; for they shall not profit thee.

When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; But the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take \add them:\add* But he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, And shall inherit my holy mountain;
And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, Take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.

For thus saith the high and lofty One That inhabiteth eternity, whose name \add is\add* Holy; I dwell \add in\add* the high and holy \add place\add*, With him also \add that is\add* of a contrite and humble spirit, To revive the spirit of the humble, And to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
For I will not contend for ever, Neither will I be always wroth: For the spirit should fail before me, And the souls \add which\add* I have made.
For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, And he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to \add him that is\add* far off, and to \add him that is\add* near, saith the \sc Lord\sc*; And I will heal him.
But the wicked \add are\add* like the troubled sea, When it cannot rest, Whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
\add There is\add* no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
